overview: From 2025-06-10 to 2025-06-11, elizaos/eliza had 22 new PRs (20 merged), 1 new issues, and 12 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Unable to load custom characters after upgrading to 1.0.7
topIssues.author: jonathanprozzi
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

After upgrading an existing project to use `@elizaos/core` version `1.0.7`, our custom character is no longer registered as an agent. Opening the chat interface/dev environment on `localhost` only shows Eliza as an agent and not our character. This previously worked with `1.0.6`. 

I tested with a newly scaffolded project and set up a character there as well and noticed the same behavior with only Eliza being shown as an agent.

**To Reproduce**

- Upgrade an existing project to use `"@elizaos/core": "^1.0.7"` or start a fresh one using this version
- Create a new character file with character settings and load that as the agent in the `index.ts`
- Start the server
- Open `localhost` to view the chat/dev environment and check if custom character is there -- we only saw Eliza and not our agent

Code snippets for characters:

`herbert.ts` snippet:

```typescript
export const herbert: Character = {
  name: 'Herbert',
  plugins: [
    '@elizaos/plugin-sql',
    ...(process.env.EVM_PRIVATE_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-evm'] : []),
    ...(process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-anthropic'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-openai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-knowledge'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-local-ai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.DISCORD_API_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-discord'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TWITTER_USERNAME ? ['@elizaos/plugin-twitter'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-telegram'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.IGNORE_BOOTSTRAP ? ['@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap'] : []),
  ],
... (more settings)
}
```

`index.ts`:
```typescript
const herbertAgent: ProjectAgent = {
  character: herbert,
  init: async (runtime: IAgentRuntime) => initCharacter({ runtime }),
};
const project: Project = {
  agents: [herbertAgent],
};
```

**Expected behavior**

- Expected that Eliza would find the new character (Herbert) and register it as an agent (previous behavior in existing project)
- We didn't change any config in the existing project but after upgrading versions we could no longer find/interact with Herbert

**Additional context**

- Tested this with both a newly scaffolded project as well as in an existing project. Our existing project had our custom agent/character loading but I then upgraded to `1.0.7` and Eliza is the only registered agent. Seems to possibly be using Eliza as a fallback and ignoring our custom character files, even though they're being detected when the server starts.

topPRs.title: feat: Dynamic loading of database tables, rebuild plugin-sql,
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This is a big PR

- Rewrite plugin-sql to dynamically migrate code
- Rewrite CLI commands to load plugin dependencies, migrate db tables
- Refactor types and add service types which can be inherited by dependent plugins

Overall should not change a ton of functionality but should enable fully modular plugins. We can move konwledge / document table to the knowledge plugin, for example

topPRs.title: refactor: reorganize cli commands into modular structure
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Comprehensive refactoring of ALL major CLI commands from monolithic architecture to modular structure for improved maintainability and scalability. This PR systematically transforms large single-file implementations into well-organized, reusable modules following a consistent architectural pattern.



## Architecture Pattern

Every command now follows this consistent modular structure:

```
commands/[command]/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts          # Command registration & main entry point
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts          # TypeScript interfaces & type definitions  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ actions/          # Core business logic & operations
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [feature].ts  # Specific action implementations
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts      # Action exports
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ utils/           # Helper functions & utilities
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [utility].ts  # Specific utility implementations
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts      # Utility exports
```

## Refactoring Strategy

### **Complete Modularization**
- **87 files** created/modified in commands directory
- **10 major commands** fully refactored
- **Consistent patterns** across all modules
- **Zero breaking changes** - all imports continue to work

## Key Benefits

### **Separation of Concerns**
- **Actions**: Business logic and core operations
- **Utils**: Validation, display, and utility functions  
- **Types**: TypeScript definitions and schemas
- **Shared**: Common functionality across commands

### **Improved Maintainability**
- Individual files are focused and manageable (20-200 lines vs 300-800+ line monoliths)
- Easier to locate and modify specific functionality
- Clear boundaries between different concerns
- Consistent patterns across ALL commands

### **Enhanced Reusability**
- Shared utilities prevent code duplication
- Modular functions can be imported independently
- Common patterns for server management, file watching, plugin handling
- Centralized error handling and validation

### **Better Testing & Development**
- Individual functions can be unit tested in isolation
- Mocking dependencies is simplified
- Development workflows are now standardized
- Plugin management is consistent across commands

## Backward Compatibility

‚úÖ **Zero breaking changes** - All existing CLI commands, options, and workflows work exactly as before. The modular structure coexists with original interfaces through re-export proxies, ensuring full backward compatibility.

## Technical Highlights

- **Development Workflow**: Enhanced dev command with improved file watching and server management
- **Plugin System**: Comprehensive plugin loading, installation, and dependency resolution
- **Registry Integration**: Complete publishing pipeline for npm and GitHub
- **Environment Management**: Interactive configuration with validation
- **Testing Framework**: Unified component and E2E testing with auto-detection
- **Build Orchestration**: Modular build utilities supporting projects, plugins, and monorepos
- **Error Handling**: Consistent error handling patterns across all commands

## Impact Statistics

- **~4,000+ lines** of monolithic code refactored into focused modules
- **87 files** changed in commands directory
- **10 major commands** completely modularized
- **0 breaking changes** - full backward compatibility maintained
- **Consistent architecture** established for future development

This comprehensive refactoring transforms the entire ElizaOS CLI from a collection of monolithic commands into a well-organized, modular architecture with improved maintainability, consistency, and developer experience.

topPRs.title: feat: Reorganize API routes into logical domain-based structure
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR implements a comprehensive API domain reorganization and improves the client-side confirmation UX.

### Major API Domain Reorganization üèóÔ∏è

**Complete restructuring of the `/packages/cli/src/server/api/` directory:**

- **Deleted monolithic files**: Removed large single-file modules (`agent.ts`, `world.ts`) 
- **Created domain-based structure** with organized subdirectories:

#### `/api/agents/` - Agent Management Domain
- `crud.ts` - Create, read, update, delete operations
- `lifecycle.ts` - Start/stop/restart agent lifecycle management  
- `logs.ts` - Agent logging and diagnostics
- `panels.ts` - Agent panel/dashboard functionality
- `worlds.ts` - World/environment management for agents
- `index.ts` - Agent domain exports and routing

#### `/api/audio/` - Audio Processing Domain  
- `conversation.ts` - Conversational audio handling
- `processing.ts` - Audio processing utilities
- `synthesis.ts` - Text-to-speech and audio synthesis
- `index.ts` - Audio domain exports

#### `/api/media/` - Media Management Domain
- `agents.ts` - Agent-specific media operations
- `channels.ts` - Channel media management
- `index.ts` - Media domain exports

#### `/api/memory/` - Memory & State Management Domain
- `agents.ts` - Agent memory operations
- `groups.ts` - Group/collective memory management  
- `rooms.ts` - Room-based memory handling
- `index.ts` - Memory domain exports

#### `/api/messaging/` - Communication Domain
- `channels.ts` - Channel operations (moved from `messages.ts`)
- `core.ts` - Core messaging functionality
- `servers.ts` - Server-level messaging coordination
- `index.ts` - Messaging domain exports

#### `/api/runtime/` - Runtime Management Domain
- `debug.ts` - Runtime debugging utilities
- `health.ts` - Health checks and monitoring
- `logging.ts` - System-wide logging management
- `index.ts` - Runtime domain exports

#### `/api/shared/` - Common Utilities Domain
- `file-utils.ts` - File handling utilities
- `middleware.ts` - Security middleware (Helmet, rate limiting)
- `response-utils.ts` - Standardized API response helpers
- `validation.ts` - Input validation utilities
- `uploads/index.ts` - File upload handling
- `index.ts` - Shared utilities exports

#### `/api/system/` - System Configuration Domain
- `environment.ts` - Environment configuration (moved from `env.ts`)
- `index.ts` - System domain exports

#### `/api/tee/` - TEE (Trusted Execution Environment) Domain
- `tee.ts` - TEE operations (moved from `tee.ts`)
- `index.ts` - TEE domain exports

### Backend API Improvements
- **Fix agent start/stop endpoints** to use proper REST patterns (`POST /agents/:id/start`, `POST /agents/:id/stop`)
- **Add missing channel operations** - implemented `deleteChannel` and `updateChannel` methods
- **Fix URL path mismatch** in frontend `deleteChannelMessage` API call (was using "messaging" instead of "messages")
- **Add security middleware** with Helmet and rate limiting for production readiness
- **Standardize response handling** with consistent error/success response utilities
- **Remove legacy test files** and cleanup obsolete testing infrastructure

### Frontend Confirmation System Improvements  
- **Replace browser alerts with proper modal confirmations** using Radix UI AlertDialog
- **Create reusable ConfirmationDialog component** to avoid code duplication
- **Add useConfirmation hook** for consistent confirmation state management across components
- **Update confirmation patterns in**:
  - Agent deletion (agent-settings.tsx) 
  - Chat deletion and clearing (chat.tsx)
  - Agent stopping (stop-agent-button.tsx)
  - Group channel deletion (app-sidebar.tsx)
- **Use direct JSX rendering** pattern with `<ConfirmationDialog>` components

### Technical Details
- **Backend**: Complete API domain reorganization, security middleware, missing endpoints, standardized utilities
- **Frontend**: Eliminated window.confirm usage, implemented accessible modal dialogs
- **Type Safety**: Proper TypeScript interfaces for all new components and hooks
- **Architecture**: Modular, domain-driven API structure for better maintainability
- **UX**: Consistent confirmation dialogs with proper destructive action styling

### Test Plan
- [x] Build passes successfully
- [x] All confirmation dialogs work with proper modal UX
- [x] Agent start/stop operations work correctly
- [x] Channel operations (create/delete/update) function properly
- [x] No remaining window.confirm browser alerts
- [x] API domain reorganization maintains functionality

## Breaking Changes
- Agent API endpoints moved from `/agents` to `/api/agents` 
- Agent start/stop now use `POST /agents/:id/start` and `POST /agents/:id/stop` instead of PUT operations
- API file structure completely reorganized (affects imports for custom extensions)

## Files Changed
- **Backend**: 47 API files reorganized, security middleware, missing endpoints
- **Frontend**: Confirmation system, dialog components, hook utilities  
- **Dependencies**: Added helmet, express-rate-limit, @types/helmet
- **Structure**: Complete API domain reorganization from monolithic to modular architecture

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced robust, modular API endpoints for agent, messaging, media, audio, memory, and system management with improved security, validation, and error handling.
  - Added new endpoints for audio processing (transcription, text-to-speech, speech conversation) and secure media uploads for agents and channels.
  - Enhanced confirmation dialogs in the user interface for destructive actions, providing a consistent and user-friendly experience.
  - Improved documentation with new and updated API endpoint references.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Addressed frontend loading issues by aligning API routes and improving chat context detection.

- **Refactor**
  - Reorganized API routing structure for clarity and scalability, replacing legacy endpoints and consolidating related routes.
  - Enhanced file upload security and validation, including stricter filename sanitization and MIME type checks.

- **Chores**
  - Added security middleware and rate limiting for all API endpoints.
  - Updated dependencies to include security and rate-limiting libraries.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: migrate CLI prompts from prompts library to @clack/prompts
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
Replaces the legacy `prompts` library with modern `@clack/prompts` across all CLI commands for enhanced user experience and type safety.

## Changes Made
- ‚úÖ **All CLI commands migrated**: create, env, publish, update, plugins
- ‚úÖ **Core utilities updated**: cli-prompts, env-prompt, get-config, github 
- ‚úÖ **Enhanced UX features added**:
  - Intro/outro messages for workflows
  - Spinners for save operations  
  - Better validation with clearer error messages
  - Improved cancellation handling with proper exit codes
  - Setup instruction notes (e.g., GitHub token creation)
- ‚úÖ **Type safety improvements**: Better TypeScript validation throughout
- ‚úÖ **Backward compatibility**: All existing CLI flows maintained

## Benefits
- **Modern UX**: Visual feedback with spinners, structured intro/outro flows
- **Better Accessibility**: @clack/prompts has superior keyboard navigation and screen reader support
- **Type Safety**: Improved TypeScript validation and error handling
- **Consistency**: Unified prompt library across CLI codebase
- **Maintainability**: Single modern library vs multiple legacy ones

## Testing
- [x] All CLI tests passing (`bun run test:cli`)
- [x] Build successful with no TypeScript errors  
- [x] Interactive flows verified to maintain existing behavior
- [x] Cancellation handling tested (Ctrl+C)

## Files Changed
- `package.json`: Added @clack/prompts@^0.11.0 dependency
- `src/commands/*.ts`: Updated create, env, publish, update commands
- `src/utils/*.ts`: Updated cli-prompts, env-prompt, get-config, github utilities
- `bun.lock`: Updated dependency lockfile

## Next Steps
Future improvements that could be made in separate PRs:
- [ ] Migrate `plugin-creator.ts` from inquirer to @clack/prompts (complex multi-step forms)
- [ ] Add more @clack/prompts features like progress bars for long operations
- [ ] Consider adding `clack.log.step()` for multi-step processes
- [ ] Evaluate adding `clack.group()` for related prompt groupings

## Migration Details
### Before (prompts library):
```typescript
const response = await prompts({
  type: 'text', 
  name: 'value',
  message: 'Enter value:'
});
```

### After (@clack/prompts):
```typescript
const value = await clack.text({
  message: 'Enter value:',
  validate: (input) => input ? undefined : 'Value required'
});

if (clack.isCancel(value)) {
  clack.cancel('Operation cancelled.');
  process.exit(0);
}
```
